alert.note: Alert for Dickens; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:35PM CDT until June 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DICKENS AND SOUTHWESTERN KING COUNTIES... At 934 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 10 miles northeast of Girard, or 16 miles north of Jayton, moving south at 25 mph. Storm organization looks to have decreased somewhat in the past 10 minutes but the threat of a tornado remains. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Dickens and southwestern King Counties. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
